result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah D Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $51 witness fees for witness Devon B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191904 in court 3x on 10/19/15, 1/5/16, 2/5/16.
Witness fee request prepared for Devon B. was approved for 3 appearances on 10/19/15, 1/5/16, 2/5/16 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Devon B. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $378.28 payable to Devon B.  Restitution to be collected by 6/6/2016. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Elijah D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for restitution hearing.  Defendant was not produced.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Elijah D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for restitution hearing.  Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Victim was in court this morning.  Court orders case adjourned for restitution hearing to branch 45.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties, defendant, and Devon B.

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to case 14CT1249 and concurrent to count 3, with credit for 6 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

AS TO COUNT 3 AMENDED
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to case 14CT1249 and concurrent to count 2, with credit for 6 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

Conditions of probation:
-AODA assessment
-Mental Health Assessment
-No contact with Devon B or Demetrious B
-Absolute Sobriety
-Anger Management Classes
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, by 4/19/2017, or a civil judgment will be entered. 

Filed, 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Driver Safety Plan Assessment Form, Sentencing Referral Form, Two Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Case adjourned to branch 45 for a Restitution Hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered case Dismissed, But Read In. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant waived rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 3 AMENDED
Defendant waived rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 3
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor.  Review hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Jury Trial set for 10-19-2015 at 08:30 am in Branch 45.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal. Morgan Wilz, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request.  All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant may qualify for Veteran's Treatment Court.  Defense requests another plea and sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: missed telephone contact on 05-20-2015.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEMETRIUS B. AND DEVON B. OR THEIR RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Elijah D Jackson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Elijah D Jackson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
